result.execSummary:
The defendant Lauren A. FREE was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Morphine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: concurrent with Case Files 15 CF 575, 15 CF 685 and 15 CF 698.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Maintain full-time employment/schooling combination.  
Obtain HSED/GED.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Maintain absolute sobriety except for current prescribed medications for mental health.   

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Submit DNA and pay surcharge.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lauren A. FREE

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

Defendant waives her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for trial.

Minutes.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.   Preliminary hearing is set for 08-26-15 at 1:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $2,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and defendant must report to the Manitowoc City Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours.
